raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


The term "high affinity" antibody as used herein refers to an antibody having 1X 10 to the target antigen <sup>-7</sup> M or less, more preferably 5X 10 <sup>-8</sup> M or less, even more preferably 1X 10 <sup>-8</sup> M or less, even more preferably 5X 10 <sup>-9</sup> M or less, and even more preferably 1X 10 <sup>-9</sup> M or lower KD value.
The term "IC50", also referred to as "half inhibitory concentration", as used herein, refers to the concentration of inhibitor (e.g., VEGF antibody) required for 50% inhibition of a target, e.g., an enzyme, cell, receptor, cytokine, etc.
